segments.text: I notice the woman’s apron is perfectly tied, but her kitchen is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and she doesn’t even glance at it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool like it’s the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the girl’s fingers wiggling, waiting for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole thing feels like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting closer to her other foot, and she still hasn’t noticed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window makes the scene look almost serene, but it’s anything but.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything seems on the surface.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so focused on the cookies that they don’t see the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR
